text:
“Damn it all!” Pyotr Petrovitch exclaimed. 

He paused, lost in thought. 

“If I marry, I’d present my wife with a lover. 

‘My dear,’ I’d say, ‘I love you, but respect me.’ 

Am I right?” 

He sniggered, but it lacked joy. 

Lebeziatnikov noticed Pyotr’s distraction. 

“What’s got you so excited?” he asked. 

Pyotr rubbed his hands together, deep in contemplation.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Luzhin expresses a cynical view on marriage, suggesting he would encourage his wife to take a lover to maintain mutual respect.
